Crispy Air Fryer Bacon

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your breakfast game with perfectly crispy bacon? Look no further than this simple and efficient recipe for Crispy Air Fryer Bacon! Using just a handful of ingredients, you can achieve that mouthwatering, crunchy texture that everyone loves without the mess of traditional frying. The air fryer not only cooks the bacon to perfection but also reduces the fat content, making it a healthier option for your morning meal or any time snack. This cooking method ensures that each slice gets evenly cooked and incredibly crispy, all while saving you time and effort. Whether you’re adding it to a classic BLT sandwich, crumbling it over a salad, or simply enjoying it on its own, this air fryer bacon is a game changer. Let’s dive into the quick and easy steps to achieve bacon bliss in no time!

Ingredients

bacon strips

Choose high-quality bacon for the best flavor and texture; thick-cut bacon will take longer to cook but will yield a chewier texture, while regular cut will be crispier. If you're looking for healthier options, turkey bacon or plant-based bacon can be used, but be aware that they may not crisp up the same way. For enhanced flavor, consider marinating the bacon in a mixture of brown sugar and black pepper before cooking. Ensure the strips are laid out in a single layer in the air fryer for even cooking; overcrowding can lead to uneven results.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Air Fryer

    Set your air fryer to 400°F (200°C) and allow it to preheat for about 3-5 minutes. This step is crucial as it ensures that the bacon begins cooking immediately, resulting in a crispier texture.

  • Step 2: Arrange the Bacon Strips

    Take 8-10 slices of bacon and lay them in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Do not overlap the strips; this allows the hot air to circulate freely around each piece, ensuring even cooking and maximum crispiness.

  • Step 3: Cook the Bacon

    Air fry the bacon for 8-10 minutes. It’s important to flip the bacon halfway through cooking (around the 4-5 minute mark) to achieve an evenly crispy result on both sides.

  • Step 4: Check for Doneness

    After 8 minutes, check the bacon for your desired level of crispiness. Cooking times may vary based on the thickness of the bacon and your personal preference. If you like it extra crispy, you may want to add a minute or two.

  • Step 5: Remove and Drain Excess Grease

    Carefully remove the bacon from the air fryer using tongs and place it on a plate lined with paper towels. This will help absorb any excess grease, leaving you with perfectly crispy bacon.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when the bacon is done?

Check the bacon at the 8-minute mark. It should be crispy and golden brown. If it's not to your liking, continue cooking in 1-minute increments until it reaches your desired doneness.

Can I cook different types of bacon in the air fryer?

Yes! You can use regular, thick-cut, or even turkey bacon. Just adjust the cooking time based on thickness; thicker bacon may need a bit more time.

What should I do if the bacon is curling up in the air fryer?

You can use a fork to gently press down on the bacon strips while cooking. This helps them stay flat and cook evenly.

Is there a way to reduce the grease splatter in the air fryer?

Yes! Lining the bottom of the air fryer basket with parchment paper can help catch grease and make cleanup easier. Just make sure it’s safe for high temperatures.

How do I clean my air fryer after cooking bacon?

Let the air fryer cool down, then wipe the basket and tray with a paper towel to remove excess grease. You can wash them with warm, soapy water or place them in the dishwasher if they’re dishwasher safe.

Can I cook more than one batch of bacon at a time?

Yes, just be sure to cook in batches if your air fryer is small. Overcrowding can lead to uneven cooking.

What can I do with leftover bacon?

Leftover bacon can be stored in the fridge for about 5 days. You can add it to salads, sandwiches, or even toss it into scrambled eggs for added flavor!

What safety precautions should I take when using the air fryer?

Always use tongs to remove the hot bacon, and be careful of hot steam when opening the fryer. Also, keep the air fryer on a heat-resistant surface to avoid damage.

Can I use frozen bacon in the air fryer?

Yes, but it's best to thaw it for even cooking. If using frozen bacon, increase the cooking time and separate the slices as they thaw.

What is the best way to store cooked bacon?

Let the bacon cool completely, then store it in an airtight container in the fridge. You can reheat it in the air fryer or microwave for a few seconds.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those looking for alternatives, consider turkey bacon or plant-based bacon substitutes that are available for a lower-fat or vegetarian option. Ensure that the bacon is gluten-free if serving to guests with dietary restrictions, and check for preservatives or additives if serving to those with specific dietary concerns.

Pairings

Crispy Air Fryer Bacon pairs beautifully with a variety of dishes. For breakfast, serve it alongside scrambled eggs, avocado toast, or in a breakfast burrito. It also complements salads, such as a Caesar salad, or can be crumbled over baked potatoes. For beverages, consider a rich coffee or a spicy Bloody Mary to enhance the savory flavors of the bacon.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the crispy bacon strips on a warm plate, garnished with freshly chopped herbs like parsley or chives for a pop of color. Pair with a small bowl of maple syrup or honey for dipping, or serve alongside a selection of dips like spicy mustard or aioli. For a brunch setting, present the bacon on a charcuterie board with cheeses, fruits, and crackers to create an inviting atmosphere.
